definition: to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
lit. sandpiper and clam war together (and the fisherman catches both) (idiom); fig. neighbors who can't agree lose out to a third party
two tigers fighting (idiom); fierce contest between evenly matched adversaries
when two kingdoms are at war, they don't execute envoys (idiom)
pinyin: liang3 guo2 xiang1 zheng1 , bu4 zhan3 lai2 shi3

definition: if two tigers fight, one will get injured (idiom)/if you start a war, someone is bound to get hurt
pinyin: liang3 hu3 xiang1 zheng1 , bi4 you3 yi1 shang1

definition: see 楚漢戰爭|楚汉战争[Chu3 Han4 Zhan4 zheng1]
term in TCM describing the progress of disease as an opposition between vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4] and pathogeny 邪氣|邪气[xie2 qi4]
lit. sandpiper and clam war together and the fisherman catches both (idiom); fig. neighbors who can't agree lose out to a third party
pinyin: yu4 bang4 xiang1 zheng1 , yu2 weng1 de2 li4

sentences.english: But for property buyers are concerned, it is common snipe mussels competing and profit.
sentences.chinese: 但對於購房者來講，卻是鷸蚌相爭，漁翁得利。

sentences.english: Never get into fights with ugly people, they have nothing to lose.
sentences.chinese: 完全不要和長得醜的相爭，他們已經沒什麼可輸的了。

sentences.english: Two dogs strive for a bone, the third runs away with it.
sentences.chinese: 二狗相爭一骨頭，第三隻狗銜起走。

sentences.english: Lai I repeatedly promise, want to see the play.
sentences.chinese: 賴爺連連答應，要看鷸蚌相爭。

sentences.english: Do not accuse a man for no reason- when he has done you no harm.
sentences.chinese: 如果人沒有加害於你，你不可無故與他相爭。

sentences.english: Who would win a fight between a lion and a tiger?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得獅虎相爭，誰會勝？

sentences.english: a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, [there is] no rest.
sentences.chinese: 智慧人與愚妄人相爭，或怒，或笑，總不能使他止息。

sentences.english: With skill, Nepal could play one off against the other.
sentences.chinese: 尼泊爾可以坐看鷸蚌相爭。

sentences.english: With mighty wrestlings have I wrestled with my sister, and have prevailed.
sentences.chinese: 我以天大的力量與我姐姐相爭，得到勝利了。

sentences.english: Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, striving against sin.
sentences.chinese: 你們與罪惡相爭，還沒有抵擋到留血的地步。

sentences.english: Two dogs strive for a bone,the third runs away with it.
sentences.chinese: 兩狗相爭一骨頭，第三隻狗銜起走。

sentences.english: If a wise man goes to court with a fool, the fool rages and scoffs, and there is no peace.
sentences.chinese: 智慧人與愚妄人相爭，或怒，或笑，總不能使他止息。

sentences.english: Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.
sentences.chinese: 人未曾加害與你，不可無故與他相爭。

sentences.english: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest.
sentences.chinese: 智慧人與愚妄人相爭，或怒，或笑，總不能使他止息。

sentences.english: One who is guilty of a trespass or sin; a sinner.
sentences.chinese: 兄弟間的敵對相爭，是最原始的一種罪。

sentences.english: The struggle between Chu State and Han State lasted for eight years, yet he eventually failed.
sentences.chinese: 然而項羽卻是個例外，楚漢相爭八年，他最終失敗了。

definition: to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
to strive
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
extinct
disaster of war
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
political relations
to comment/to evaluate
fight
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
to be chivalrous
predestined fate (Buddhism)
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
the enemy and us
